The central tracks run between the left platform and a second platform on the right, which also extends from the foreground to the background. As the time-lapse progresses, the train departs by moving from the foreground toward the background, revealing the empty tracks in the center. Concurrently, people on both platforms appear as motion blurs moving horizontally through the middle ground, contrasting with the static station architecture and the advertisements lining the wall in the right foreground and middle ground. The station features a distinctive arched, vaulted ceiling and walls lined with white brick tiles. The camera maintains a deep focus, keeping the entire scene sharp. Throughout the shot, the camera performs a very smooth trucking movement, steadily moving to the left as the train departs and people blur across the platform. The station itself is characterized by its classic vaulted, white-tiled ceiling and walls, with two platforms flanking the central tracks. As the train pulls away, it reveals the dark, intricate network of rails, while advertisements, including prominent ones for "MAUBOUSSIN" and "PRINTEMPS," line the walls, adding a layer of commercial context to the public space. An overlay in the bottom right corner contains the text "MATHIEU STANIC PHOTOGRAPHY."
